title: Corso bids farewell to 'GameDay' with OSU pick
content: Lee Corso picked the Buckeyes to beat Texas on his final appearance on ESPN's "College GameDay" on Saturday, making the prediction on the 50-yard line at Ohio Stadium.

title: Schroder subjected to racial abuse at EuroBasket
content: Germany captain Dennis Schroder faced racial abuse during his team's 107-88 victory over Lithuania at EuroBasket on Saturday. German officials said two were identified and ejected from the arena in Finland.

title: Deion healthy in return, says Buffs 'fine' after loss
content: Deion Sanders said he "felt good" just months after having surgery this spring and, despite criticizing his run defense, said he saw enough good things in Friday's loss to still expect a strong season.

title: Drama 'resolved,' Parsons thrilled for fresh start
content: Micah Parsons was introduced by the Packers on Friday and said he was relieved and excited to get back to playing football after a contentious offseason in Dallas.

title: Sale rejoins Braves after 2 months on injured list
content: The Braves have reinstated left-hander Chris Sale from the 60-day injured list, and he is expected to start against the Phillies on Saturday.

title: Miami LB Hayes charged with vehicular homicide
content: Miami linebacker Adarius Hayes has been charged with three counts of vehicular homicide and one count of reckless driving with serious bodily injury following an investigation into a May crash that killed three people.

title: Suspended Little Leaguer's bat sells for $10K
content: The bat tossed in the air by a New Jersey Little Leaguer to celebrate a home run that earned him a suspension later lifted by a judge sold for nearly $10,000 at auction.

title: üèà Adam Schefter's fantasy football cheat sheet
content: No one is more plugged in to the latest buzz around the NFL than Adam Schefter. We asked him to share his favorite values in fantasy drafts with you.

title: Lee Corso's impact felt far beyond 'GameDay' audience
content: The larger-than-life face of college football has touched so many, from fans and players to colleagues and friends.

title: VAR controversy masks Chelsea's issues in win over Fulham
content: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca will have to concede that his side was lucky to beat Fulham on Saturday.

title: Four questions in the Micah Parsons trade aftermath: Why in the world would Dallas do this?
content: What are the Cowboys doing? Did they get enough in return? And does Parsons put the Packers at the top of the NFC? Let's sort through this wild trade.

title: A new look in Green Bay: Parsons trade continues Packers' aggressive offseason
content: Signs of change in Green Bay include paying up to trade for Parsons after finally taking a WR in the first round.

title: Chasing history: Can Derrick Henry run past seven Hall of Famers to reach top 10 all time?
content: The Baltimore Ravens running back sits at No. 19 on the rushing list and has a chance to bypass seven Hall of Famers.

title: Why do some players think the US Open courts and balls are slow -- and others call them fast?
content: US Open organizers insist the conditions are the same as last year. But players disagree. The catch: They can't decide if they're faster or slower.

title: College football betting: Go with the experienced Irish or wild-card Canes?
content: The Fighting Irish head to Miami as small favorites after making it to the national championship game last season. Here's how to bet the game.

title: Betting NFL milestones: Mike Evans and Derrick Henry chasing down history
content: Potential career milestones are on the horizon for several players. We predict if they get there in 2025.

title: Guide to the NFL's rookie class: Who is flying under the radar? Who will win OROY, DROY?
content: Here's everything you need to know about this group of first-years, including Rookie of the Year front-runners, fantasy favorites and QB updates.

title: Let's predict the draft: Kiper's 10 preseason takes, including why all eyes are on Penn State
content: How many quarterbacks will go in Round 1? Mel Kiper Jr. makes predictions for the 2026 NFL draft class.

title: Breaking down Texas-Ohio State, LSU-Clemson and 24 other matchups in an epic Week 1
content: College football is back in a big way, with Arch Manning and Texas taking on the defending champs, a showdown in Death Valley and more.

title: Toto Wolff admits he misses 'great enemy' Christian Horner in F1
content: Mercedes boss Toto Wolff has admitted he misses having his "great enemy" Christian Horner in the Formula 1 paddock after Horner was sacked by Red Bull after 20 years in charge of the team.

title: From Collier to Clark and more: How injury returns could impact the playoffs
content: Napheesa Collier and Breanna Stewart are back, with more injured stars eyeing returns before the postseason.

title: Debunking your favorite NFL officiating conspiracy theories
content: Are the refs penalizing some teams more than others? Which coaches win challenges? We crunched the numbers.

title: NBA predictions: 10 teams that could exceed, fall short of ESPN's forecast
content: Too low on OKC? Too high on the Spurs? Tim Bontemps breaks down ESPN's Summer Forecast win predictions.

title: Liz Loza's draft rules (there are none!), five players to pick and two to fade
content: It's finally time to make picks, so consider the trends surrounding these players as you prepare your draft board.

title: Mike Clay's Playbook, Part 3: How to manage your team post-draft
content: The draft is just the beginning of the fun. Mike Clay gives you a guide to being a savvy, championship-winning manager.

title: Baylor's anthracite and chrome combo headline best college football uniforms from Week 1
content: While Baylor revives its gold chrome helmets, Utah State will be donning cow print helmets that have a hilarious origin story.

title: Ben Shelton and Trinity Rodman relationship timeline
content: The NWSL player playfully challenged the tennis star with a question about his 2nd-round US Open performance.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea could make late move for Barcelona star L√≥pez
content: Chelsea could make a fresh offer for Barcelona star Ferm√≠n L√≥pez. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'The Rich Eisen Show' on ESPN: How to listen and watch
content: 'The Rich Eisen Show' is joining forces with ESPN platforms! Find out how to get your weekday dose of pop culture and sports now.

title: Trump to skip India visit? US President may not attend 2025 Quad meet - Report
content: US President Donald Trump's planned visit to India for the Quad Summit is off, signaling a deterioration in his relationship with Narendra Modi. The souring ties stem from Trump's repeated, and disputed, claims of resolving the India-Pakistan conflict, coupled with Modi's refusal to endorse Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize.

title: 'Don‚Äôt talk nonsense': Tej Pratap slams 'abki baar Tejashwi sarkar' chant; calls out 'ego'
content: Tej Pratap Yadav, recently ousted from his family and party, criticized egoism in leadership during a Jehanabad gathering, distancing himself from chants of "Abki Baar Tejashwi Sarkar." He emphasized that government formation relies on the people, not individuals, cautioning against arrogance. Lalu Prasad Yadav expelled Tej Pratap for six years due to disregard for moral values and irresponsible behavior.

title: US embassy to visa applicants in India: This passport service has been discontinued
content: Starting August 1, 2025, the US will discontinue third-party passport collection services for visa applicants. Individuals can collect their passports in person or opt for home delivery at a fee of Rs 1,200. For applicants under 18, a parent or guardian must collect the passport with an original consent letter from both parents and required identification.

title: 'I want my Porsche': Yuvraj Singh‚Äôs six-sixes bat now with Lalit Modi ‚Äì here‚Äôs why
content: Lalit Modi, the IPL's founder, pledged a Porsche to any Indian cricketer hitting six sixes or taking six wickets in an over during the 2007 T20 World Cup. Yuvraj Singh famously achieved this feat against Stuart Broad, prompting Modi to fulfill his promise. Yuvraj received his Porsche, and Modi acquired the iconic bat, a cherished memento of that historic moment.

title: India‚Äôs urban families face 9x higher school expenses than rural households
content: A recent survey reveals a significant disparity in education costs across India. Urban families spend considerably more on private schooling than rural families on government education. Tuition fees and coaching classes contribute to this divide. Families bear most of the financial burden. This highlights inequities in the education system.

title: 'False & baseless': PIB busts Pakistan claim of India's S-400 hit; clarifies image origin
content: The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has refuted Pakistan's propaganda claiming India's S-400 air defence system was damaged during Operation Sindoor. PIB clarified that reports of destruction are false, and the circulated image is from a 2010 Russian parade. India launched Operation Sindoor after the Pahalgam terror attack, striking terror hubs, and intercepted Pakistani drones and missiles using the S-400.

title: Tesla loses verdict it plans to appeal, says lawyers misled jury on Musk
content: Tesla is contesting a $243 million verdict in a fatal Autopilot crash case, alleging that the opposing lawyers misled the jury by focusing on Elon Musk and irrelevant evidence. The company argues that the verdict could stifle innovation and harm road safety. Tesla maintains its technology wasn't responsible, while plaintiffs contend the 'Autopilot' name was misleading.

title: 50 gold medals! India create history in Asian Shooting Championship
content: India made history at the 16th Asian Shooting Championship in Shymkent, Kazakhstan, securing a leading 50 gold medals. The senior team excelled in Olympic events, earning six gold, two silver, and three bronze medals, only behind China. Junior shooters also shone, contributing significantly to India's total of 99 medals, surpassing Kazakhstan and China in the overall standings.

title: Dhankhar applies for pension; seeks MLA benefits - why was it stopped in 2019
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar, after resigning as Vice President citing health issues, has applied to resume his pension as a former legislator in Rajasthan. He previously received this pension until becoming the governor of West Bengal in 2019. Now 74, Dhankhar is entitled to a monthly pension of Rs 42,000, with the Rajasthan Assembly secretariat processing his application following his resignation.

title: Tesla bull on Nvidia CEO: Jensen is 10% politician; shares take on company stock
content: Tesla investor Dan Ives praises Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang. Ives addresses geopolitical risks between the US and China. Nvidia aims to sell Blackwell chips in China. The company is willing to meet US government terms. Ives is optimistic about Nvidia's future. He predicts Nvidia's market value could reach $5 trillion by early 2026. He now favors Nvidia over Palantir stock.

title: 'Photo-op, Truth posts': Why PM Modi avoided Trump‚Äôs calls, Washington invite
content: The last officially acknowledged phone call between PM Modi and Trump took place on June 17, when Trump left the G7 Summit in Canada abruptly and flew back to Washington. A bilateral meeting between the two leaders, planned on the sidelines of the summit, had to be cancelled. During that call, Trump invited PM Modi to stop over in Washington.

title: Trump tariff: Ministry drafts multi-tier plan to shield Indian exporters
content: The Commerce Ministry of India is developing a strategy. This strategy aims to support Indian exporters facing new US tariffs. The plan includes easing liquidity and offering flexibility to SEZ units. It also promotes import substitution. E-commerce export hubs will be operationalised. The government will focus on financial and non-financial support.

title: 'Less than 50 weapons': IAF on Op Sindoor; reveals why Pak asked for ceasefire
content: Air Marshal Narmdeshwar Tiwari recounted Operation Sindoor, revealing that fewer than 50 weapons strikes by the IAF on Pakistani military targets compelled Islamabad to request a ceasefire by May 10. These precision strikes, some hitting targets untouched even in the 1971 war, demonstrated India's air dominance and strategic planning, effectively conveying a strong message while minimizing collateral damage.

title: Israeli airstrike kills Houthi rebel PM Ahmed al-Rahawi in Sanaa
content: Israeli airstrikes in Sanaa, Yemen, resulted in the death of Ahmed al-Rahawi, the Houthi prime minister, along with several ministers during a government workshop. The Israeli military confirmed targeting a Houthi site, amidst ongoing Houthi attacks on Israel and Red Sea shipping in support of Palestinians. Earlier strikes this week in Sanaa caused numerous casualties, escalating tensions in the region.

title: Watch: Pilot rescued in 30 seconds after dramatic plane crash off Oak Island
content: A pilot, Mark Finkelstein, miraculously survived a plane crash off Oak Island, North Carolina, after his engine failed mid-air. He was rescued within 30 seconds by the Oak Island Water Rescue team after the plane flipped upside down upon impact.

title: PM Modi in China: Meet with Xi, Putin lined up amid Trump tariff strain - list of SCO attendees
content: Tianjin is preparing to host the SCO Summit, with President Xi Jinping welcoming leaders including PM Modi and President Putin. Against a backdrop of global tensions heightened by US tariffs, the summit aims to project China as a stabilizing force and foster unity among the Global South. Discussions will likely encompass counterterrorism, trade, and a multipolar world order.

title: Makhachev‚Äôs coach: From Syko Stu‚Äôs provocation to Rampage Jackson‚Äôs son clash
content: Javier Mendez, Islam Makhachev's coach, addressed the Raja Jackson-Syko Stu Smith incident, suggesting provocation from Smith and instigation from other wrestlers. Mendez argued that KnokX Pro Wrestling organizers were also at fault for placing an untrained MMA fighter, Raja Jackson, in an unscripted wrestling match without proper guidance. The incident, involving serious injuries to Smith, is currently under police investigation.

title: Yellow brick road‚Äô under Pacific: Volcanic rock revealed; deep sea mystery inspires awe
content: Deep in the Pacific, researchers aboard the E/V Nautilus discovered a peculiar, yellow brick road-like structure at nearly 3,000 meters. Initially sparking Atlantis comparisons, the formation is actually a hyaloclastite, shaped by ancient volcanic activity. This finding highlights the vast unknown of the deep sea and offers insights into the Pacific Ocean floor's volcanic history and Earth's crust evolution.

title: George Pickens reacts: "It was good for me" ‚Äî Micah Parsons traded to Green Bay Packers
content: In a stunning NFL trade, the Dallas Cowboys sent star edge rusher Micah Parsons to the Green Bay Packers for two first-round picks and Kenny Clark. Parsons promptly signed a record-breaking $188 million extension with Green Bay, becoming the highest-paid non-quarterback.

title: Will Pakistan travel to India for Jr Men's WC 2025? Hockey India reveals
content: Pakistan's junior hockey team will participate in the FIH Junior Men's Hockey World Cup 2025 in Tamil Nadu. This follows Pakistan's withdrawal from the Asia Cup due to security concerns. The World Cup will be held in Chennai and Madurai. India and Pakistan are in Pool B. New policies allow Indian participation in events with Pakistani athletes.

title: Pen cap stuck in lung for 26 yrs: Delhi doctors remove object; express shock
content: A Delhi man lived with a pen cap lodged in his lung for 26 years after accidentally swallowing it as a child. Doctors at Sir Ganga Ram Hospital successfully removed the object, a rare case due to the lack of immediate complications.

title: 'Good to see such fear': RJD MP claims RSS 'sleeper cell' abused PM
content: RJD MP Sudhakar Singh alleged that BJP and RSS "sleeper cells" orchestrated the abuse directed at PM Modi during a Bihar opposition rally, echoing Congress's claim of planted "BJP agents." This follows a viral video showing unidentified men hurling abuses at PM Modi and his mother during Rahul Gandhi's Voter Adhikar Yatra.

title: Allu Kanaka Ratnamma's demise: Allu Arjun meets Chiranjeevi - Watch
content: Allu Arjun returned to Hyderabad from Mumbai following the demise of his grandmother, Allu Kanaka Ratnamma. He was seen at the Allu residence, joined by numerous Telugu film personalities offering condolences. Megastar Chiranjeevi and Allu Arjun shared an emotional moment. Director Trivikram Srinivas and producer Naga Vamsi were also present.

title: Tighter US visa norms: Students rethink choices; universities brace for impact
content: Proposed changes to US student visa rules could limit international student stays to four years, replacing the flexible ‚Äúduration of status‚Äù model. This move is expected to impact Indian students more than their Chinese counterparts, as many Indians depend on post-study work routes such as OPT and H-1B visas. Chinese students often pursue funded PhDs or return home, facing less disruption. The shift may prompt Indian students to consider alternative destinations like the UK, Germany, and Australia.

title: Patrick & Brittany Mahomes: Motherhood‚Äôs emotional toll on NFL star‚Äôs wife
content: Brittany Mahomes, wife of Patrick Mahomes and mother of three, recently shared her experiences with the challenges of motherhood. She highlighted the difficulty of balancing personal time with childcare responsibilities and confessed to struggling with mom guilt when accepting help or leaving her children. Despite these struggles, she remains a dedicated supporter of her husband's NFL career.

title: Shubman Gill, Rohit Sharma, Jasprit Bumrah reach BCCI's CoE for fitness tests
content: The BCCI Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru is buzzing with activity as Indian cricketers gear up for upcoming tournaments. Rohit Sharma, along with Jasprit Bumrah, Shubman Gill, and others, underwent pre-season fitness tests under Adrian le Roux. Discussions are ongoing about Rohit potentially playing for India 'A' before the Australia series.

title: 'India, a long live economy': Shivraj slams Trump‚Äôs ‚Äòdead economy‚Äô remark
content: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Chouhan refuted Donald Trump's "dead economy" remark, citing India's 7.8% GDP growth in April-June. BJP leaders criticized Rahul Gandhi for supporting Trump's statement, highlighting the strong economic figures as evidence of India's progress under Prime Minister Modi's leadership towards becoming a developed and self-reliant nation.

title: Rahul offers candies to black-flag protesters in Bihar - watch
content: During his 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' in Bihar, Rahul Gandhi faced black flag protests from BJYM workers over alleged remarks against PM Modi. In a surprising gesture, Gandhi offered candies to the protesters. He also accused the BJP, RSS, and Election Commission of 'vote chori' during the ongoing electoral roll revision, claiming it's an attack on the Constitution.

title: Watch: Chinese chess player spends 4 hours in heavy rain after loss
content: A video shows a Chinese man analysing his chess loss in the rain. Grandmaster Hans Niemann shared a similar experience. Anish Giri joked about his rain-free victory. Niemann criticised the American chess system, praising India's support for players. Divya Deshmukh received a Rs 3 crore prize for her chess achievements. Chess passion continues to inspire globally.

title: Lord of Sakar uncovered: 2,100-year-old Thracian warrior tomb
content: Bulgaria showcases Hellenistic heritage at the National Archaeological Institute. The exhibition features treasures from a Thracian warrior's tomb. The warrior is known as the Lord of Sakar. Gold artifacts, jewelry, and horse accessories are on display. The discovery reveals Thracian craftsmanship and culture. The warrior's grave is the most opulent found in Bulgaria.

title: Mayhem! 11 sixes in 12 balls: India batter goes into monster mode
content: Salman Nizar's explosive batting propelled Calicut to an improbable victory in the Kerala Cricket League. Nizar smashed a record-breaking 86 off 26 balls, including 11 sixes in the final two overs, to score 71 runs. This remarkable onslaught transformed a struggling innings into a match-winning total, etching his name in T20 history.

title: 'Horrific murder': Zelenskyy confirms ex-speaker Parubiy shot dead; vows probe
content: A Ukrainian lawmaker and former speaker of parliament, Andriy Parubiy, was fatally shot in Lviv, prompting a swift condemnation from President Volodymyr Zelensky. Zelensky denounced the killing as a "horrific murder" and pledged a thorough investigation into the incident. Authorities have mobilized all available resources to investigate the crime and apprehend the perpetrator, as confirmed by the president.

title: Jason Kelce banned: ESPN blocks star from YouTube's Chargers vs Chiefs stream
content: YouTube's pursuit of Jason Kelce for its exclusive Chargers-Chiefs broadcast in Brazil was thwarted by ESPN. Kelce, now an ESPN analyst, is restricted from appearing on competitor platforms like YouTube due to a new company policy. This decision marks a shift from last season, as ESPN tightens control over its on-air talent amid the rise of streaming in live sports.

title: 'After Awadh, now Magadh': Akhilesh jabs BJP at Rahul's Bihar rally; slams RSS
content: Akhilesh Yadav has criticized RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's claim about Indians sharing the same DNA for 40,000 years, turning it into a political jab during a rally in Bihar. Yadav referenced the BJP's losses in Uttar Pradesh and called for a similar defeat in Bihar, while also pledging support to Tejashwi Yadav in the upcoming assembly polls.

title: Conor McGregor vs Nate Diaz: UFC's fiercest rivalry hits White House stage
content: Nate Diaz has hinted at a potential third fight with Conor McGregor, suggesting it could happen at a special UFC event on July 4, 2026, at the White House. Dana White has confirmed the event, which is planned as part of America's 250th Independence Day celebrations. Both fighters have expressed interest, fueling anticipation for the long-awaited trilogy fight.

title: 'Financial ruin' for US? What happens if Trump tariffs are struck down by court ‚Äî Explained
content: A US federal court has dealt President Trump a blow, ruling his sweeping tariffs illegal, stating he exceeded his authority by declaring trade deficits as national emergencies. While the tariffs remain during appeal to the Supreme Court, businesses face continued uncertainty. A potential $159 billion refund looms if the ruling stands, weakening Trump's negotiating power.

title: Security lapse! Babar Azam chased, hugged and kissed by fan during match in Pakistan
content: Despite Babar Azam's Asia Cup 2025 exclusion, his popularity remains high. A fan breached security during a veterans' match, hugging and kissing him. Selectors dropped Azam and Rizwan, citing other players' form, appointing Salman Agha captain. The squad includes Mohammad Wasim, Salman Mirza, and Fakhar Zaman.

title: From Puri to Delhi: Jagannath Rath Yatra wheels to adorn Parliament
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has approved a proposal to install three wheels from the Puri Rath Yatra chariots in the Parliament premises. The Shree Jagannath Temple Administration (SJTA) presented the proposal during Birla's visit to Puri. Each wheel will represent the chariots of Lord Jagannath, Devi Subhadra, and Lord Balabhadra, symbolizing Odisha's rich cultural and spiritual heritage.

title: Dravid, Pandit and more: Full list of coach, player changes since IPL 2025
content: Following IPL 2025, Rajasthan Royals' head coach Rahul Dravid steps down after a long association, while Kolkata Knight Riders sees the departure of head coach Chandrakant Pandit and bowling coach Bharat Arun. Pandit, despite leading KKR to a title in 2024, exits after a challenging 2025 season, with Abhishek Nayar returning as assistant coach.

title: Panic at petrol pump: Staff shot for refusing fuel to helmetless youths in MP
content: In Bhind district, Madhya Pradesh, a petrol pump worker was shot and injured for refusing to serve fuel to two helmetless youths, adhering to district rules. The enraged youths returned with firearms, and one opened fire, injuring the worker. Police have identified the accused from CCTV footage and eyewitness accounts and are pursuing their arrest.

title: Maratha quota stir: Traffic comes to standstill in Mumbai ‚Äî Top developments
content: Manoj Jarange's hunger strike in Mumbai intensifies, demanding a 10% Maratha quota under the OBC category without reducing existing OBC reservations. Jarange warns the government against testing the community's patience, accusing them of misinformation. Traffic in South Mumbai is disrupted as protesters gather, coinciding with the Ganesh festival.

title: Braving 22 Hours Of Waves, Winds, Cold, Mumbai Man Swims Across English Channel
content: Braving strong sea currents and cold water temperatures, Mumbai's Avinash Thadani completed a solo swim across the English Channel in 22 hours.

title: "Maharashtra Government Working To Resolve Issue Legally": Devendra Fadnavis On Maratha Quota
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday said his government was working to address the demands of Maratha quota activist Manoj Jarange within the legal and constitutional framework.

title: India Has "Walked Away" From US Trade Talks Due To Tariffs: Ex-Top Official
content: Former Finance Secretary Subhash Garg has hit out at US President Donald Trump's repeated claims that India is "profiteering" massively from discounted Russian oil, calling the charge "political theatre, not economic reality."

title: Ex-Veep Jagdeep Dhankhar Wants Pension As Rajasthan MLA Restarted, File In Process
content: Former Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar, who resigned on July 21, citing health reasons, has written to the Rajasthan Assembly asking for his pension as a former Congress MLA from the state to be restarted.

title: Ahead Of PM Modi's Meeting With Putin In China, A Phone Call From Zelensky
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi had a telephone conversation on Saturday with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky ahead of the SCO summit, where they discussed the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict.

title: Leopard Carcass Found On Gurugram-Faridabad Road
content: The carcass of a leopard has been found on the Gurugram-Faridabad road, with police suspecting it to be a case of roadkill since a leg and the jaw of the animal were found shattered.

title: From Pepsi To McDonald's, US Giants Face Swadeshi Heat Amid Trump Tariffs
content: A wave of anti-US sentiment has gripped India since US President Donald Trump imposed 50 per cent tariffs on the South Asian nation. The tariffs on India, which were slapped due to its purchase of Russian oil, are among the highest in the world.

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar Applies For Pension As Rajasthan Ex-MLA
content: Former vice-president of India Jagdeep Dhankhar has applied for a pension as a former legislator in Rajasthan, officials said.

title: Video: Telangana Cop Slaps Farmer Over Urea Demand, Sparks Row
content: A video showing a Sub-Inspector of Police slapping a farmer during a dispute over urea supply has gone viral on social media, sparking widespread condemnation and protests in the Narayanpet district of Telangana.

title: Drunk School Teacher Found Lying On Road In Madhya Pradesh, Video Goes Viral
content: A government teacher was found lying on the road outside a school's premises in an inebriated condition in Madhya Pradesh's Mauganj, sparking anger among locals who called for his suspension.

title: Called To Discuss Marriage Proposal, Woman's Family Beats Man, 26, To Death
content: The woman's family had called the man on the pretext of discussing the marriage proposal but then beat him to death, said the Maharashtra police. Rameshwar Ghengat was 26.

title: "Beautiful To See": CEO On ISRO's Safety Intervention For Axiom-4 Mission
content: Praising ISRO's role in the Axiom-4 mission, Axiom Space CEO Tejpaul Bhatia has also commended agency Chairman Dr V Narayanan's insistence on a thorough investigation of the rocket following an oxygen leak.

title: Rahul Gandhi Offers Toffees To Protestors Showing Him Black Flags At Bihar Rally
content: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi stopped his car and tried to distribute candies (or toffees) to protestors showing him the black-flag over the alleged abuses hurled at PM Narendra Modi and his late mother during the 'Voter Adhikaar Yatra'

title: Lessons From Op Sindoor? What 3 Ex Armed Forces Chiefs Said At NDTV Defence Summit 2025
content: The former chiefs of all the three armed services have highlighted the need for looking at not only a two-front war scenario, but across all domains - air, land and sea - in multiple fronts.

title: PM Modi In China After 7 Years, Set To Meet Xi Jinping Tomorrow
content: Trump's 50% tariffs on India, including a 25% 'penalty' for buying Russian oil, are being seen as having brought New Delhi closer to both Beijing and Moscow.

title: 1 Killed In Blast At House In Kerala's Kannur, Probe Points To Firecracker Storage
content: One person was killed and another injured in a powerful blast at a house in Kannur's Kannapuram area early on Saturday morning.

title: "Marathwada Marathas Must Be Declared Kunbis": Activist Jarange Patil
content: Activist Manoj Jarange on Saturday told a delegation led by retired High Court judge Sandeep Shinde that the government must declare all Marathas of Marathwada as Kunbis and give them a reservation.

title: PM Modi China Visit Highlights: PM Modi Arrives In China For Regional SCO Summit
content: PM Modi China Visit Day-1: Prime Minister Narendra Modi landed in China on Saturday on a keenly watched visit that assumed greater significance in view of sudden downturn in India-US ties triggered by Washington's policies on tariff.

title: CBI Books Airport Authority Manager For Embezzling Rs 232 Crore Into His Personal Accounts
content: The CBI has registered an FIR against a senior manager of the Airport Authority of India for allegedly siphoning off more than Rs 232 crore into his personal accounts through a complex trail of fictitious accounting entries in three years

title: Cars Submerged, Houses Flooded After Heavy Rain In Gujarat's Himmatnagar
content: Videos showed residents struggling to navigate the flooded streets in Himmatnagar. Knee-deep water forced people to wade through the streets.

title: Who has a shot at the championship? Projecting conference and Finals winners
content: this season, the Oklahoma City Thunder will look to become the first back-to-back champions since 2018 . but there will be plenty of challengers . the new york Knicks have plenty of postseason experience to push even fury .

title: News: Red Sox, Mets promote pitching prospects
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the franchise will activate Jackson Chourio from the 10-day IL in advance of this afternoon's contest . he's expected to resume his role as the every-day centerfielder .

content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Where will your team's next ballpark be? What Royals can teach us about the future of MLB stadiums
content: The K is located in the Truman Sports Complex, next to Arrowhead Stadium . your feelings about that location might depend on how you view the relationship between baseball and the cities in which it is played . in 2021, so long ago that Bobby Witt Jr. had not yet debuted in the majors, Royals owner John Sherman announced a search for a new venue .

title: College football hot seats: Brace yourselves for potential blue-blood turnover
content: the college football job market took an expected turn last year . last offseason, there was a dip in head coaching changes at FBS football . the year before, a record 32 jobs turned over, per NCAA statistics .

title: 'Due to US, Canada': Study abroad spends by Indians hit 5-yr low; UK benefits
content: Sleeping, yet awake! 9 animals who do it best 9 reads to strengthen discipline and consistency 10 snake-repellent plants to guard the home naturally Nature's giants: 10 animals that reach humongous heights Promotional looks of Janhvi Kapoor for 'Param Sundari' Mouni Roy‚Äôs top 10 gorgeous ethnic looks for festive season Aishwarya Lekshmi's jaw-dropping pics Munmun Dutta‚Äôs gorgeous ethnic looks for Ganpati In pics: Stunning looks of Divya Pillai In pics: Adorable looks of Nazriya Nazim Determine the monthly installment amount for a loan Estimate the returns on investments made through SIPs Find out maturity amount and interest earned on PPF Check maturity amount and interest earned on an FD Estimate the pension amount and corpus accumulated under NPS A Mutual Fund Calculator helps estimate the future value of investments

title: PLL semifinals preview: Stats, matchups, how to watch
content: the 2025 premier lacrosse league playoffs continue this weekend on ESPN . the four teams travel to Subaru Park outside of Philadelphia for the semifinals . sports analyst Quint Kessenich revealed his keys to both matches . all 14 of the waterdogs' win in the quarterfinal came from their three attackmen .

title: Week 1 preview: Player expectations, freshmen to watch and more
content: all eyes will be on no. 1 Texas - No. 3 Ohio State as the Longhorns travel to the Horseshoe on sunday . quarterback arch Manning and Ohio State wide receiver Jeremiah Smith will play in a tough road matchup to start the season .

title: What we're hearing before transfer deadline day: Liverpool to return for Isak?
content: the transfer window is only open across Europe until Monday . sportsmail's reporters are hearing about possible deals if Alexander Isak returns to the first-team . the premier league champions have played the long game with the striker . click here for more transfer news .

title: The game is on the line: Which WNBA player gets the last shot?
content: a clutch shooter is the biggest in the WNBA, according to stats . a team needs a bucket to tie the score or win the game . here are our picks for the players who should have the ball in their hands .

title: MLB Power Rankings: Where every team stands as final month approaches
content: alden Gonzalez and Jesse Rogers weigh in on who they like most to come out on top of the American League wild-card race . teams are mostly split into three categories: those preparing for the playoffs, those trying to make a run at contention and those whose focus has turned to next season . there's still a fair amount to play for within those groups .

title: Piastri takes pole ahead of Norris at Dutch GP
content: McLaren's Oscar Piastri starts on pole ahead of teammate Lando Norris at the 2025 Dutch Grand Prix . the f1 driver beats his teammate and title rival to the fastest time in qualifying by 0.012 seconds . norris had looked like the favorite for pole throughout free practice .

title: LIVE updates: Man United salvage late win vs. Burnley, Bournemouth beat Spurs
content: a controversial VAR intervention ruled out a goal when the score was goalless . a 97th-minute Bruno Fernandes penalty earned Fulham their first win of the season, defeating Burnley 3-2 . however, their less-than-convincing performance continues to raise questions about the portuguese manager after a humiliating carabao cup exit against Grimsby Town .

title: Tulane starts BYU transfer QB Retzlaff for opener
content: former BYU QB Jake Retzlaff started at quarterback against Northwestern . he went 11-2 as a starter for the Cougars in 2024 . his transfer came in the wake of an honor code violation that would have resulted in a suspension .

title: Ready to seek support from BJP top brass if they allow me: INDIA bloc V-P candidate
content: Justice (retd) B. Sudershan Reddy said he had sent letters to all members of the Rajya Sabha and Lok Sabha to consider his candidature on merit

title: Election Commission gets close to 2 lakh requests to remove¬†names from Bihar voters‚Äô list
content: The poll body got 29,872 requests for inclusion in the voters‚Äô list and 33,771 complaints settled. ECI deadline to file objections to the draft electoral roll ends on August 31

title: GST demands by Opposition-ruled States are ‚Äòperfectly legitimate‚Äô, says Jairam Ramesh
content: The Congress party hoped the GST Council meeting next week would ‚Äònot merely be a headline-grabbing exercise‚Äô, but would ‚Äòadvance the cause of cooperative federalism‚Äô

title: Honey on high
content: In Kashmir‚Äôs Pulwama, scientists from CSIR‚Äôs Indian Institute of Integrative Medicine take Peerzada Ashiq through the production process of India‚Äôs first bio-authenticated honey. Selling for between ‚Çπ5,000 and ‚Çπ6,000 per kilogram¬†in the global market, India has the potential to join countries like France, Spain, Italy, Bulgaria to compete in the high-end mono-floral honey sector¬†

title: Dharmasthala case: SIT probing responsibly and there is no need to hand over case to NIA, says Home Minister
content: SIT is doing its work with great responsibility as crores of devotees have expressed their concern and awaiting the truth: Parameshwara

title: Telangana Assembly to debate PC Ghose Commission‚Äôs report on Kaleshwaram on Sunday
content: Speaker Gaddam Prasad Kumar chairs the Business Advisory Committee (BAC) meeting in the Assembly on Saturday

title: BRS walks out of BAC meet protesting govt. plan to ‚Äúrun session for only two days‚Äù
content: Harish Rao says government appears to be interested in taking up issues serving its political interests, not people

title: Analysis: What awaits PM Modi at SCO Summit?
content: Modi‚Äôs meetings with Xi, Putin and ‚Äòanti-West‚Äô SCO leaders, and the attendance of Pakistan PM Sharif, Turkey‚Äôs Erdogan and Nepal‚Äôs K.P. Oli will be watched closely during the Tianjin visit; the SCO could issue a strong statement on Israel‚Äôs war in Gaza, which India may have to sign

title: Chargesheet filed against two for falsely implicating beauty parlour owner in drug case
content: Parlour owner spent 72 days in jail on charge of possession on LSD stamps, which were later found to be fake. Chargesheet filed against her daughter-in-law‚Äôs sister and her friend

title: Arvind Bellad takes exception to Vidhana Soudha‚Äôs banquet hall¬†being used for private function
content: He condemned the government for allowing a felicitation programme marking 50 years of professional service of former Advocate General Prof. Ravivarmakumar to be held at the hall

title: Nagaland medical students stage protest against govt decision to regularise 280 health workers
content: They argued that the government‚Äôs decision to bypass written exams for Class-I posts sets a dangerous precedent. Under the Nagaland Health Service Rules, recruitment for such posts requires 100% selection through NPSC.

title: Krishi Mela should help farmers tackle emerging challenges in farm sector: Santosh Lad
content: The farm fair, to be conducted from Sept. 13 to 16, is an important platform to provide farmers with information on new farm technologies, cropping methods and value addition to farm produce, he stresses

title: Government to replace the Ordinance on 42% reservations for BCs with a Bill in the Assembly on Sunday
content: The Panchayat Raj Act passed in 2018 during the previous BRS regime was the biggest hurdle as it capped total reservations for SCs, STs and BCs in local bodies at 50%, Minister Ponnam Prabhakar explained

title: Stepfather gets 55 years rigorous imprisonment for abusing minor girl
content: The accused has been fined ‚Çπ40,000. Failure to remit the fine will entail an additional two years and four months of imprisonment

title: Shivaji was not anti-Muslim, asserts Minister Lad
content: Shivaji Maharaj fought for the protection of all castes and religions, and he should not be confined only to the Maratha community, he states

title: 1,910 students graduate from NIT-C
content: Union Minister Sukanta Majumdar says NIT-C was the first such institute in the country to get designated by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs as a ‚Äòcentre of excellence in urban planning and designing‚Äô

title: Modi reassures Ukraine of India's support during call with Zelenskyy
content: During call with Volodymyr Zelenskyy, PM Modi discusses bilateral partnership progress and reaffirms support for peace in Ukraine

title: Karnataka HC directs Centre  to file response on interim plea on online gaming bill
content: The court has adjourned to September 8 the hearing on a petition challenging the Constitutional validity of the newly-enacted Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming (PROG) Act, 2025

title: Traffic grinds to a halt on NH stretch between Mudikkode and Peechi
content: Congestion lasts for a few hours, with hundreds of vehicles stranded. Both the service road and the main carriageway remained clogged. The collapse of the Mudikkode service road cited as primary reason for the gridlock

title: e-Health services gain momentum in Kottayam
content: e-Health facility to be implemented in nine more places this year in Kottayam. The facility is available in 45 centres out of 88 hospitals in the district currently

title: Minister releases digital magazine of students‚Äô works
content: Mazha Mannilezhuthiyathu includes students‚Äô writings, paintings and cartoons that featured at the Kerala State School Arts Festival this year

title: Shed fear of attrition and invest boldly in Andhra Pradesh, Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu exhorts industrialists
content: Six MoUs worth ‚Çπ2,000 crore signed in the presence of Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu, and they have a potential to generate 18,000 jobs

title: Victims of human-wildlife conflict, their kin should be made aware of legal rights, says SC judge
content: Judges speaking at a regional meet on human-wildlife conflicts call for a holistic, ecocentric approach to the issue

title: CPI(M) urges Andhra Pradesh govt. to release ‚Çπ10,000 crore for permanent Budameru flood prevention
content: Party says government has failed to implement lasting solutions since last year‚Äôs floods, leaving Vijayawada residents at risk

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar seeks pension from Rajasthan Assembly as former MLA
content: The pension from the State Assembly payable to Dhankhar will be in addition to the pension he will draw as the former Vice-President and an ex-MP

title: Projects worth ‚Çπ180 crore to be launched at Thiruvananthapuram MCH
content: Development projects worth ‚Çπ717.29 crore are ongoing at Thiruvananthapuram Government Medical College Hospital. First phase projects have been completed and those in the second phase are at various stages of construction

title: Yadgir teen pregnancy case: Probe by retired district judge ordered
content: The Karnataka Residential Educational Institutions Society (KREIS) has ordered an investigation by a retired district judge into the case of a class 9 student delivering a baby in a government-run school in the Yadgir district.

title: Incessant rain triggers landslides in northern West Bengal; National Highway 10 closed
content: The closure of NH10 has affected the main route connecting Sikkim and West Bengal; restoration work is underway

title: Family protests woman‚Äôs death after C-Section at Belagavi government hospital
content: Inquiry will be initiated and the concerned staff, if found guilty, shall be punished, says Taluk Health Officer

title: Ganesh idols made with ‚Äòunique objects‚Äô dot streets of Tirupati
content: Expert says that since ages, generations of painters and sculptors have taken the creative liberty to portray Lord Ganesh in different ways, however, this year‚Äôs idols have strictly adhered to divine themes as against the contemporary developments

title: Thrissur Corporation moves to disqualify six BJP councillors
content: Action planned under provisions of the Municipal Act and the Local Self-Government Election Act for allegedly spreading propaganda and filing cases that led to financial losses for the local  body

title: Maoists kill ‚Äòshikshadoot‚Äô in Chhattisgarh, sixth this year
content: Police sources said ‚Äòshikshadoots‚Äô are being targeted on suspicion of being police informers. Bastar Inspector General of Police P. Sundarraj said Maoists are killing teachers as they want to deprive the native population of education

title: Group of Ministers to recommend how to use the palatial buildings at Rushikonda in Vizag ¬†
content: The GoM, as per G.O. RT NO. 1586, can empanel special invitees, if required, and is mandated to submit its recommendations at the earliest

title: Tourist terminal for houseboats at Kumarakom fails to take off
content: The terminal, built at at a cost of ‚Çπ3.29 crore with a capacity to accommodate up to 40 houseboats and located at a prime location along one of the most scenic stretches of Vembanad Lake, has remained largely unused even six years after its formal inauguration.

title: Centre directs Kerala to submit DPR for seaplane service project
content: State government seeks response of KIIFCON-RITES, a joint venture which was entrusted with the task of holding a feasibility study on setting up airstrips in Idukki, Wayanad and Kasaragod districts, on preparing the DPR for seaplane project in three months

title: Vigil stepped up in Kozhikode ahead of Onam to track drug peddlers
content: The anti-narcotics squads have already collaborated with the special squads of the Excise, Railway Protection Force, and the Motor Vehicles departments to ensure strict vigil at all possible public spots

title: What does the Supreme Court‚Äôs push to regulate social media mean for free speech?
content: Experts told The Hindu that any new regulations for India‚Äôs digital media must be framed with care to avoid infringing on freedom of expression

title: Indian economy to sustain high growth momentum in coming quarters: CEA Nageswaran
content: ‚ÄúThe Centre, along with various stakeholders, are actively working overtime to cushion the export sector from the U.S. tariffs,‚Äù the CEA said

title: Warangal unit of Kitex begins commercial production
content: Comes at a time when infant and children‚Äôs apparel explores new markets and seeks to reduce reliance on the mainstay U.S.¬†

title: Bringing Krishna waters to Kuppam a defining moment in my political journey, says Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: Recalling the strenuous efforts in making it a reality and the periods of setbacks the project faced, particularly during the YSRCP term, the Chief Minister reiterates the plan to take up Polavaram-Banakacherla project to drive away drought in Rayalaseema

title: Give priority to concrete road to Edmalakkudy, Collector tells PWD
content: Collector‚Äôs directive follows death of two persons due to delayed medical care in  the absence of proper road connectivity to the tribal panchayat

title: BRS stages protests on urea crisis in State on Day 1 of Assembly session
content: KTR says their party is ready to debate on any issue, but urea is priority subject now when compared to other issues

title: Dash cams help police crack crashes, catch culprits, cut confusion
content: TGSRTC buses as well vehicles plying for school/educational institutions have been ordered to install and use dash cams

title: Live updates: Arch Manning and No. 1 Texas in Columbus facing No. 3 Ohio State
content: After an entertaining Week 0 appetizer and a smattering of games Thursday and Friday, it's time for Week 1 of the college football season to finally kick off. And the game to start off the first full Saturday of the season couldn't be much better. It's the  Texas Longhorns  vs. the  Ohio State Buckeyes . It's the No. 1 and No. 3 teams in the preseason AP poll facing off. It's a College Football Playoff rematch and Arch Manning's first major test as starter against the defending national champions. Needless to say, it's going to be good. We'll be keeping track of Texas-Ohio State -- and any other notable happenings that might pop up -- as the college football season returns. Here's everything that's going on across Week 1 in college football:
